job_overview: A Domestic Worker provides essential services to households, ensuring that the home runs smoothly and remains in good condition. Their duties can vary depending on the employer's needs but generally include cleaning, laundry, cooking, and caring for children or elderly family members. They may also perform administrative tasks or run errands. The role demands trustworthiness, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently or under minimal supervision.

job_overview: DOMESTIC WORKERS OR HOUSEMAIDS ARE THE PERSONS ENGAGED IN DOMESTIC WORK WITHIN AN EMPLOYMENT RELATIONSHIP.” DOMESTIC WORK IS DEFINED AS “WORK PERFORMED IN OR FOR A HOUSEHOLD OR HOUSEHOLDS.” THE WORK MAY INCLUDE CLEANING, COOKING, WASHING AND IRONING, TAKING CARE OF CHILDREN, ELDERLY OR SICK MEMBERS OF A FAMILY, AS WELL AS HOUSEHOLD PETS, GARDENING AND GUARDING THE HOUSE WHEN EMPLOYERS ARE NOT AROUND. THIS IS A FULL TIME WORK WHICH REQUIRES STAYING IN THE RESIDENCE OF EMPLOYER UNTIL THE PERIOD OF WORKING CONTRACT ENDS. BELOW ARE THE QUALIFICATIONS, REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTED RESPONSIBILITIES OF UGANDAN DOMESTIC WORKERS OR HOUSEMAIDS.

job_overview: A Female worker is required who has at least completed high school or graduated and is able to speak English and with a recommendation from the guardians to travel to Saudi Arabia. She must have passed the medical requirements and with training provided to her. She will be doing the house chores such as washing clothes (laundry), cleaning the house washing utensils, sweeping the compound, and ensuring that the house is always clean and not messed up. She must be 18 years and above and fit for work.
